byline.original: By WINNIE HU and JENNY ANDERSON
byline.contributor: Winnie Hu reported from Farmingdale, and Jenny Anderson from New York.

abstract: College Board will hire former FBI director Louis J Freeh to review its security procedures in response to the arrest of seven Long Island teenagers accused of cheating on the SAT; group will also begin analyzing more test scores for irregularities and increase training for test-center supervisors.
snippet: The College Board said it was hiring a former F.B.I. director to review its testing procedures.
lead_paragraph: The College Board said it was hiring a former F.B.I. director to review its testing procedures.

headline.main: SAT Officials Vow More Security After Cheating Arrests on Long Island
headline.print_headline: SAT Officials Vow More Security After Cheating Arrests on Long Island
headline.seo: SAT Officials Vow Tighter Test Security After Arrests
